title.narrative: OUTPUT 027: BUDGETING AND POLICY

description.narrative: Output 27: Policy Analysis and Advocacy: annual research and advocacy outputs on child poverty and inequality lead to increased equitability of resource allocation., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 8: Policy analysis and advocacy, M&E, and Communications: Policy analysis and advocacy, M&E, and external Communications are based on evidence, linked to functional M&E systems, and are used to reduce child poverty and encourage equitable development.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT GAR
REGIONAL DIRECTOR OF HEALTH GHANA HEALTH SERVICE NORTHERN REGION

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 27: Policy Analysis and Advocacy: annual research and advocacy outputs on child poverty and inequality lead to increasedequitability of resource allocation.

description.narrative: Parliamentarians agreed to examine use of the District League Table to better allocate local resources; 70 per cent of stakeholders claimed to use the tool. Ghana's first research network was established. The UNICEF/Ministry of Finance partnership produced draft tools to improve resource accountability. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Improved equity of national budget for reducing child poverty

baseline.value: 8m GHS in 2012 budget for LEAP, 2bn GHS spent on fuel subsidies

target.value: 2017:132m GHS spent on LEAP in 2017, 0 GHS spent on main fuel subsidies

actual.value: 2017:80m allocated to LEAP in 2017, however 160m allocated in 2018 budget this November. Higher budget expenditure in 2017 was not achieved as enrollment of new households had not been completed by the Ministry. 0 GHS spent on main fuel subsidies.

title.narrative: District League Table (DLT) 2017 launched by end November 2017

baseline.value: DLT 2017 yet to be launched as of March 2017

actual.value: 2017:DLT successfully launched in November with widespread media coverage and commitment by Govt to consider its use in resource allocation

title.narrative: A clear partnership and calendar established to execute production of a national tool for budget accountability by end 2017

baseline.value: No clear partnership and calendar available as of March 2017

target.value: 2017:Clear partnership and calendar established by end of 2017

actual.value: 2017:Draft of national accountability tool completed, partnership with MoF established, additional capacity to Ministry now in place.

title.narrative: High standard external UNICEF Ghana publications on equity and poverty produced and used for evidence-based advocacy

target.value: 2017:Journal published/other peer-reviewed publication focus of major national event

actual.value: 2017:Peer-reviewed paper on child poverty finalized (part of regional event), peer-reviewed paper with IDS on social protection policy frameworks completed and published, Research network launched.
